title: Elise and Thresh don the Blood Moon mask

replies.body: These look awesome! I vote blood moon {{champion:120}}  next :P
He has Blood Knight Hecarim in the same theme.

Bloodmoon is very Japanese inspired taking influences from oni themes and kabuki theater.

In my opinion, they are *very* different themes.
You might want to rethink the Kabuki theater idea when you see Elise.
I animated her recall actually. It's not kabuki, her skin isn't embracing that like the others. Kabuki plays a major role in kalista and thresh animations though.
Then, why is it a Blood Moon Skin? Does Spider form alone let the rest of the skin contradict the theme?

Bloodmoon theme isn't strictly kabuki though. That was **one** of our inspirations.

We the animators decided it'd be cool if their recalls were related to traditional Japanese culture in some form or another. It just so happened that Kabuki was a strong influence on Kalista (which I also animated) and Thresh. For Elise I wanted to do something else that played off the more beautiful and calm appearance of her human form as well as the lore of the "Jorōgumo".


If we were making strict kabuki skins, they'd all have to be male characters (all actors in kabuki theater are male, the females in the stories are played by men with heavy make-up on)
So... Blood Moon Hecarim confirmed? {{summoner:31}}
But {{champion:84}}  has a Blood Moon skin...
Rofl, this guy
However it would be a really cool Hecarim skin I must admit.

Well there's a reason why Diana will not be getting a Blood Moon themed skin. She actually already has one technically. Her lunar skin is suppose to play a role in the story as the Hero. There was a whole reddit post explaining the whole thing I'll have to search it up.

Feel it everywhere and you see it growing,
Enemies arise and the hate is flowing,
Shattering the moon and bloodying the sky.

The machines of war will fuel both sides,
And the greed will only grow more lies;
Farewell to days of peace 'cause now it's time to die.

I suggest perhaps spider W also gives a mov speed boost for added utility.
